An absent-minded hacker leaked half their RSA private key digits. The encrypted flag is: 3354142322688067707343251112156456031554921901251849165848666266246916527831673307483170097174538490996030287165193650337080140300098234755601326276626961. Can you recover the message from this partial exposure?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=7676055720317029652312274655091707484304998693968098302197655797081705008457550896644346816528538717050901972911763384390450893472140451471805215431158427, e=2372910524309236680872862083294676772774351388900539820727487230845160094393839832104904644936085704332838797839626742885941068484089462503979402176561343, partial_p=16837225214737614822

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{zbbuqsdz}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3354142322688067707343251112156456031554921901251849165848666266246916527831673307483170097174538490996030287165193650337080140300098234755601326276626961
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=7676055720317029652312274655091707484304998693968098302197655797081705008457550896644346816528538717050901972911763384390450893472140451471805215431158427, e=2372910524309236680872862083294676772774351388900539820727487230845160094393839832104904644936085704332838797839626742885941068484089462503979402176561343, partial_p=16837225214737614822
extra_info: p=105688975614525860676056098588296130293976722302613547009066675038358320303409, q=72628726654646796366976172622115919328620219852064495392696913349095034769803, Ï†(n)=7676055720317029652312274655091707484304998693968098302197655797081705008457372578942077643871495684779691560862140787448296215429738687883417762076085216
subtype: partial_key_exposure
